item.title: Compress and encrypt your backups
item.description: It’s always recommended to backup your data for safety, but for safety AND security let’s encrypt your backups! to compress and encrypt with ‘mypassword’: tar -Jcf - directory | openssl aes-256-cbc -salt -k mypassword -out backup.tar.xz.aes to decrypt and decompress: openssl aes-256-cbc -d -salt -k mypassword -in backup.tar.xz.aes | tar -xJ -f - Another trick with the tar command is useful for remote backups: tar -zcvfp - /wwwdata | ssh root@remote.
